document_data.name: Grainhouse
document_data.owner: [[Granary Workers' Guild of Purskul and Outlying Villages]]
document_data.mainbody: The '''Grainhouse''' was an ancient landmark and the guildhall of the [[Granary Workers' Guild of Purskul and Outlying Villages]] in [[Amn]].
document_data.Structure: The Grainhouse was one of the oldest structures in the town of [[Purskul]]. It was a large stone tower, a [[gristmill]], and a granary.
document_data.History: By the late 14{{th}} century [[DR]], the Grainhouse was claimed by the Granary Workers' Guild of Purskul and Outlying Villages and used as its guildhall. The landmark mill produced [[cornflour]] made using local [[corn]], worked by the [[half-tusk]] population of Purskul.
